questions.question_text: How can fatigue be prevented on a long journey?

options.a: By drinking two cups of strong coffee
options.b: By well-timed and sufficient stops for rests

questions.explanation: Stimulants like coffee only provide a short-term boost. The only way to truly prevent fatigue is to stop and rest adequately.

questions.question_text: What does 'power sound' (very loud music) in the car result in?

options.a: Signals from other traffic – in particular sirens – are not heard
options.b: Driving errors due to the driver being more relaxed

questions.explanation: Loud music masks external sounds, making it impossible to hear emergency sirens or horns from other vehicles.

questions.question_text: Above which alcohol level in your blood can you expect your fitness to drive to be impaired considerably?
questions.explanation: Impairment begins at very low levels. The book states that fitness to drive can be impaired considerably above 0.3 per mille.

questions.question_text: How long can hashish and its catabolites (decomposition products) be detected in urine?
questions.explanation: Hashish remains in the system much longer than alcohol. Traces can be found in urine weeks after consumption.

questions.question_text: Which of the following persons are unfit to drive motor vehicles?

options.a: Persons who smoke a single hashish cigarette per day
options.b: Persons who drink coffee every morning
options.c: Persons who take medication for a headache occasionally

questions.explanation: Regular drug use, even a single hashish cigarette daily, renders a person unfit to drive due to the persistent effects of the drug.

questions.question_text: What are the possible effects of hashish consumption?

options.a: Intoxication with dangerous hallucination and reduced reaction capability
options.c: Improved judgment of speed and distance

questions.explanation: Hashish causes hallucinations and significantly slows down the driver's ability to react to hazards.

options.a: He treats others like partners, drives calmly and coolly and refrains from showing that he is superior
options.b: He drives fast to ensure traffic does not pile up behind him
options.c: He insists on his right of way to maintain traffic flow

questions.explanation: A good driver is defined by their attitude: cooperative (partners), calm, and not arrogant (superiority).

questions.question_text: What should you understand by defensive driving?

options.b: Attending a special course to learn skidding
options.c: Always driving below the speed limit

questions.explanation: Defensive driving means prioritizing safety over being 'right'. You should not insist on your rights if it could cause an accident.

questions.question_text: What can cause unnecessary obstructions on the road?

options.a: Vehicles proceeding too slowly for no good reason
options.b: Vehicles stopping at a red light
options.c: Vehicles slowing down for a pedestrian crossing

questions.explanation: Driving too slowly without cause blocks traffic flow and is considered an unnecessary obstruction.

questions.question_text: What can cause a dangerous situation?
questions.explanation: Cutting corners (taking a turn too sharply) puts you in the path of oncoming traffic or off the road surface.

questions.question_text: Which documents must you carry as a driver?

options.a: Driving licence and vehicle registration certificate

questions.explanation: The law requires you to carry your driving licence and the vehicle registration certificate (blue book/card).

questions.question_text: You have sold your vehicle which is still registered. The buyer has paid. What must you do?

options.a: Hand over the vehicle registration certificate and vehicle registration book or permit for use to the buyer against receipt
options.b: Keep the documents until the buyer gets new insurance

questions.explanation: Once sold, the official documents must be physically handed over to the new owner, and you should get a receipt.

questions.question_text: What is important with regard to the official registration plates?

options.a: The rear registration plate must be lit up in darkness
options.b: The front registration plate must be lit up in darkness
options.c: Both plates must be reflective red

questions.explanation: To ensure the vehicle can be identified at night, the rear number plate must have a light illuminating it.

questions.question_text: At which intervals must you submit your car (not a new vehicle) with a diesel engine for the exhaust test?
questions.explanation: Diesel engine vehicles (that are not new) require an exhaust test every 2 years.

questions.question_text: Alterations to your vehicle have resulted in the permit for use being cancelled. What are the consequences?

options.b: You get 3 points on your license
options.c: You must pay a fine to the mechanic

questions.explanation: If the vehicle is not legally permitted for road use due to alterations, the insurance company is not liable to pay, so coverage lapses.
